author: Staff Reporter
text:
A total of 44,703 students wrote Tamil Paper I of the Secondary School Leaving Certificate (SSLC) exams in the district on Tuesday.

According to officials from the School Education Department, 577 of the 45,280 registered candidates were absent for the first exam. This included 99 of the 1,145 persons who had registered as private candidates.

The participating students found the question paper easy. “None of the questions was outside the syllabus. I finished the exams within two hours,” said S. Murugan, one of the students from Elango Corporation Higher Secondary School here.

An official from the School Education Department said that both Tamil Paper 1 and 2 have always been easy for the students. “For most of the students, mainly from Tamil medium, English will be the toughest,” he claimed.

Students from 463 schools across Madurai, Melur and Usilampatti educational districts and private candidates sat for the examination in 124 centres spread across the district. A total of 2,269 hall supervisors and 210 monitoring squads were deployed for the examination. Officials said no incidents of copying or any other malpractices were reported. Collector K. Veera Raghava Rao along with Chief Educational Officer J. Angelo Irudayasamy inspected the examination centre at St. Joseph’s Girls Higher Secondary School and checked whether uninterrupted power supply and drinking water facilities had been arranged.
title: 577 students absent on first day of SSLC exams
